chart_description: The `apps.lreads` chart displays the logical disk read throughput of various applications on your system, measured in KiB/s. This chart helps in identifying any read-heavy applications and optimizing their disk usage.

dimension_descriptions.VMs: This dimension shows the read throughput of virtual machines running on the system.
dimension_descriptions.agent_sd: This dimension shows the read throughput of Netdata plugins such as the smartd and cpu plugins.
dimension_descriptions.apps.plugin: This dimension shows the read throughput of other Netdata plugins running on the system.
dimension_descriptions.containers: This dimension shows the read throughput of containerized applications on the system.
dimension_descriptions.ebpf.plugin: This dimension shows the read throughput of the eBPF plugin.
dimension_descriptions.go.d.plugin: This dimension shows the read throughput of the Go plugins.
dimension_descriptions.httpd: This dimension shows the read throughput of the Apache HTTP server.
dimension_descriptions.kernel: This dimension shows the read throughput of the kernel.
dimension_descriptions.kube-proxy: This dimension shows the read throughput of the Kubernetes proxy.
dimension_descriptions.kubelet: This dimension shows the read throughput of the Kubernetes node agent.
dimension_descriptions.metrics-server: This dimension shows the read throughput of the Kubernetes metrics-server.
dimension_descriptions.netdata: This dimension shows the read throughput of the Netdata daemon itself.
dimension_descriptions.nosql: This dimension shows the read throughput of NoSQL databases such as MongoDB and Cassandra.
dimension_descriptions.other: This dimension shows the read throughput of other miscellaneous applications on the system.
dimension_descriptions.sql: This dimension shows the read throughput of SQL databases such as MySQL and PostgreSQL.
dimension_descriptions.system: This dimension shows the read throughput of system-level applications such as systemd and udev.
dimension_descriptions.tc-qos-helper: This dimension shows the read throughput of the `tc` utility's QoS helper.
